Articles.Content: So I just made my first trip to the surface of the Mun and was coming back. Unfortunately, I didn't have enough liquid fuel, so I had to use my RCS system to get back to Kerbin - and I had enough. I went into Munar orbit first then started my "burn" to get back to Kerbin. As I was about to get into Kerbin orbit, using my full RCS forward thrusters, my ship blew up. Any idea why? I mean it was a simple craft at that point with a command module with solar panels, two RCS tanks, and four thrusters. Do they overheat? I didn't see anything.
RCS doesn't overheat, and a Pic of the craft in question would help. It sounds like a Kraken attack, but I can't understand why such a simple ship would summon the Kraken.

This same exact thing happened to me just now. I was landing at Mun, I hit the M key to zoom out to orbital map, and suddenly a HUGE explosion happened and my lander was gone. I had no idea what exploded or why, although I think I narrowed it down because I almost always do an F5 quicksave unless I forget. In this case, I had a quicksave, so I loaded it up and I discovered my monopropellant tank (for the RCS thrusters) was almost empty. So what I think happened was that I was controlling my lander from the orbital map and made a correction that didn't execute properly because of the fuel running out. I must have impacted the surface. But wow did it ever scare me because it was a very loud explosion with a lot of bright flashes and, of course, I was not expecting it at all.

Clearly this doesn't apply to the OP because it doesn't seem they were anywhere near the Mun surface. I definitely was near it.

Edited June 17, 2014 by asb3pe
Maybe the RCS broke off and hit the rocket, making it explode. Look at the mission log (you have to end the mission). It will say what happened.

When you want to figure out what went wrong first, press F3 to show flight log.

I don't think RCS can damage or overheat any part so most probably it was some different problem or game bug.

Yeah, this is pretty unusual in stock. Are you using any mods? I don't even know of any off hand that would cause RCS to overheat/explode. Unless by some chance you also accidentally pressed the space bar and separated some equipment.
Kerbal Kraken Attack - you have take the F9 Anti-Kraken-Pill if you are F5 vaccinated
